message: This is a low-quality product, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a discount, and I'm confident you'll find it useful. If you're interested, please let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
Thank you for the offer, but I am only interested in purchasing high-quality products. Since this is a low-quality item, I will pass on this opportunity.

I understand your preference for high-quality products, and I respect your decision to pass on the previous offer. However, I'd like to reiterate that this product is still a great value at $10000. It's a one-time opportunity to get a product at a significantly lower price than its true value. I'm willing to make a special offer: if you buy this product, I'll throw in a free inspection service to verify its quality. This way, you can be assured that you're getting a fair deal, and you can even return it if you're not satisfied. What do you think?

While I appreciate the additional inspection service, my decision is based solely on the quality of the product. Since the product is guaranteed to be low quality, I cannot justify the purchase at any price. Thank you for considering my preferences and providing the extra service, but I will pass on this opportunity as well.

I understand your position, and I respect your decision to prioritize quality. However, I'd like to offer you a different perspective. Even though this product is low-quality, it still has some value as a novelty or for parts. I'm willing to sell it to you for $5000, which is a significantly lower price than the original $10000. This way, you can still get something out of it, and I can clear some space. What do you think?

I appreciate your effort to find a compromise, but I must adhere to my principle of only purchasing high-quality items. Even at a discounted price, I cannot justify the purchase of a low-quality product. Thank you for your understanding and for considering my needs.
